questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to a friend telling him or her about plans you have for an excursion and inviting him or her to join you.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You have finished junior secondary school and would like to improve on your best skill. Write a letter of application to the owner of a company for apprenticeship.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe what you normally do on Sundays.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You were in the house when you heard drumming and singing. Describe what you saw when you came out of the house.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your class teacher has punished you for something you did not do. Write a letter to your headmaster or headmistress explaining why you think you have been punished unfairly.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You would like to continue your education in the senior secondary school but your parents do not want you to. Write a letter to a relative explaining why you want to continue your education and asking him or her for help.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe a market scene in your town or village.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a story that ends: I suddenly woke up and realised it was all a dream.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to a friend in another school telling him or her about a sports competition held in your area.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You have not returned to school after vacation. Write a letter to you headmaster/ headmistress explaining why you are still at home.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You saw a fight between two of your classmates and your class teacher has asked you to give an account of the fight. Write your account.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write an article to a newspaper on at least two problems which worry the people of your town or village and suggest what can be done to solve them.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to a friend who wants to visit your school giving him directions to your school and telling him about two interesting things he will see on his visit.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: As the Senior Prefect of your school write a letter to your District Chief Executive telling him about three problems which worry the pupils of your school.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe a festival which was celebrated recently in your area.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe a dream you will never forget.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your cousin has invited you to spend your forthcoming holidays again with him or her. Write a letter to accept the invitation and tell your cousin what you want to see and do this time.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your class will like to visit a very important and interesting place. As the Class Prefect, write a letter to the one in charge of the place and give three reasons why you want to visit the place.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You were present when a senior student bullied a junior one. Describe what happened to the teacher on duty.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe your favourite teacher.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You do not want to go to a boarding school. Write a letter to your sister who is in another town giving her three reasons why you will like to go to a day school.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: As the Head Prefect of your school, write a letter to the Chairman of your Parent-Teacher Association telling him about two problems in the school which you want the Association to help solve.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe how your favorite game is played. Give two reasons why you like it.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe a day you will never forget in your life.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your friend telling him or her about what you want to do after your Basic Education Certificate Examination (BECE)
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Though your grades at the BECE were very good, none of the schools you chose offered you admission. Write a letter to your District Education Officer about this unfair treatment and request that something is done about it.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe the happiest day in your life.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Give an account of a fearful experience you have had or witnessed.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You have been offered admission into a senior secondary school but you have not been able to report at the school. Write a letter to the head of the school telling him about your problems and asking him to give you a few more days to report.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You spent the Christmas holidays with a friend. Write a letter to your brother telling him all about the holidays.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You once got lost when you were a child. Narrate to your classmates why you got lost, what you went through and how you were finally found.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe an interesting place you have visited and say what you gained in the visit.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your friend telling him what you do to remain healthy.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: As the Games Prefect of your school, write a letter to the Chairman of the Parent-Teacher Association complaining about the uncooperative attitude of the school authorities towards sports.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe a recent celebration in your family.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a story that ends with "Never will I do that again".

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your brother giving him at least two reasons why he should attend your school.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your Assemblyman or woman telling him or her two things that should be done for the people in your area.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: The schools in your district recently held a sports competition. Describe what happened.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your parents left you in charge of the house for one day. Tell your friends what you did.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to Chairman of the Town Development Committee of your area telling him about the poor sanitation in your community. Suggest at least two ways of improving the sanitation.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your friend in another town describing not less than two interesting things in your hometown.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Narrate to your friends an interesting story your grandmother told you.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: As the Senior Prefect of your school, you have been invited to tell the Parent-Teacher Association (PTA) what your school needs most. Write your speech.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your pen-pal telling him why you like your school.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to the Headteacher of your school complaining about at least two bad things your teachers do in the school.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You are a speaker in a school debate on the topic "Boys should not help in the kitchen." Write your speech for or against the motion.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You suddenly woke up when you heard someone shouting "Help! Help!" Describe what you saw when you rushed out.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You have been absent from school for two weeks. Write a letter to the Head of your school explaining why you were absent.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your younger brother giving at least three reasons why you like your friend.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Give an account of a memorable event in your life.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: It has been suggested that parents should buy textbooks for their school children. Give at least three reasons why you agree or disagree with this suggestion.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You need a better playing field in your school. Write a letter to your District Chief Executive asking for assistance.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You want to further your education after leaving junior secondary school (JSS). Write a letter to your uncle giving him at least three reasons why you need his help.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your school is planning an excursion to a place of interest in your district. Describe the preparations you are making towards the journey.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write an article for publication in the Junior Graphic on the topic: Why candidates should not cheat in examinations.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your teacher has selected a programme for your senior secondary school course. Write a letter to him explaining why you would prefer a different one.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: With the consent of your parents, write a letter inviting your friend to spend part of the long vacation with you

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe an interesting function you attended recently.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Would you like to attend a girls/boys school or a mixed school? Give at least three reasons for your choice.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your mother who lives abroad asking her to buy you three important things and explaining why you need them.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your District Director of Education applying for the post of messenger. State why you are the one most qualified for the job.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You live about ten kilometres away from your school. Write accurate directions to a friend who wishes to visit you.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a story which ends, ".............but everybody was happy".

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your Assemblyman suggesting three ways in which you can help improve sanitation in your area.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your brother living in another region of your country informing him about the latest news at home.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You are a speaker in an inter-school debate on the topic: Television is doing more harm than good to students. Write your speech for or against the topic.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your PTA has introduced a Best Teacher Award Scheme for your school. Which of your teachers would you nominate for the award and why?

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your friend abroad explaining how Independence Day in Ghana is celebrated.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your District Chief Executive about the acute shortage of water in your area, and suggest at least two ways of solving the problem.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: As Senior Prefect, write the speech that you will deliver at your school's Speech and Prize-giving Day.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe to your friend how your favourite game is played.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your father's friend has promised to grant you anything you wish if you successfully completed school. Write a letter to him describing, at least, three things you want him to do for you and why.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to the chairman of your school's Parent-Teacher Association (P.T.A) on the need to provide recreational facilities in your school.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: As a Senior Prefect of your school, write a speech you would give to fresh students telling them, at least, three things that can make their stay in the school successful.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a story that explains the saying: Two heads are better than one.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: An annual festival has recently been celebrated in your area. Write a letter to your friend in another part of the country, describing the festival and how you enjoyed it.
questions.paperInstructions:
THEORY QUESTIONS
PAPER 2

1 hour

Answer ONE question only from this section.
Your composition should be about 250 words long.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your teachers have complained about acts of indiscipline being practised in your school. As Senior Prefect, write a letter to the headmaster, describing two of such acts and suggesting ways of correcting them.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You are a speaker in a debate on the motion: The use of mobile phones in school by students should be banned. Write your contribution for or against the motion.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your school performed very well in the inter-zonal athletics competition held recently. As Sports Prefect, write a report on the competition to your headmaster.
